thread.title: Reports: Sixers Trade Nerlens Noel To Mavericks
thread.title_full: Reports: Sixers Trade Nerlens Noel To Mavericks

author: CBS Philly
title: Reports: Sixers Trade Nerlens Noel To Mavericks
text:
Reports: Sixers Trade Nerlens Noel To Mavericks February 23, 2017 11:50 AM Filed Under: Dallas Mavericks , Nerlens Noel , Philadelphia 76ers 
PHILADELPHIA (CBS) — The Philadelphia 76ers did trade a center on Thursday before the deadline — but it wasn’t Jahlil Okafor. 
The Sixers traded former first-round pick Nerlens Noel to the Dallas Mavericks, according to multiple reports. The Sixers are reportedly getting back Andrew Bogut, Justin Anderson and a first-round pick that is top-18 protected. Andrew Bogut and Justin Anderson and conditional first-round pick will be traded from Dallas to Philadelphia for Nerlens Noel, sources say 
— Marc Stein (@ESPNSteinLine) February 23, 2017 Philadelphia is sending Nerlens Noel to Dallas for Justin Anderson and a first-round draft pick, league sources tell @TheVertical . 
— Adrian Wojnarowski (@WojVerticalNBA) February 23, 2017 
David Aldridge reports the Sixers are already working on another “landing spot” for Bogut. Philly indeed working on another landing spot 4 Andrew Bogut, per source, after getting him, Justin Anderson, 1st from Mavs 4 Nerlens Noel. 
— David Aldridge (@daldridgetnt) February 23, 2017 
WIP’s Spike Eskin called the move “disappointing.” 
“Nerlens Noel was the Sixers second best player and getting better so this is disappointing,” Eskin tweeted. Nerlens Noel was the Sixers second best player and getting better so this is disappointing. 
— Spike Eskin (@SpikeEskin) February 23, 2017 
It’s a surprise move following weeks of speculation that Okafor would be the one to be shipped out. 
Noel is a restricted free agent at the end of this season. 
There were previous reports the Sixers were leaning to signing the reserve center to a contract extension. 
Noel has been averaging nearly 9 points and 5 rebounds a game this season.
